snippet: If the new government is to succeed, it will need to take immediate steps to bring about cooperation between sectarian factions.
abstract: Editorial cautions Iraq's newly configured government of Prime Min Haider al-Abadi may not prove to be dependable ally that Obama administration hopes it will be in military operation there; holds Iraqi government is unlikely to win trust of all segments of country needed to isolate Islamic State in Iraq and Syria; warns if government does not bring about cooperation, American military will find itself once again defending a self-destructive Iraqi state.
lead_paragraph: If the new government is to succeed, it will need to take immediate steps to bring about cooperation between sectarian factions.

headline.seo: Can the U.S. Count on the New Government in Baghdad?
headline.main: Tests for a Still Broken Iraq
headline.print_headline: Tests for a Still Broken Iraq

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
